scripts.build: for DIR in packages/*; do (cd $DIR && npm run build); done
scripts.preinstall: for DIR in packages/*; do (cd $DIR && npm install && npm run build); done
scripts._checkPortIsFree:
tools/port-is-free.sh $PORT || ( >&2 echo "ERROR: Port '$PORT' is taken!
"; exit 2)

dev: If we have more components (say, >4), consider 'run-p' over 'concurrently'. It can handle patterns (e.g. 'watch:**').
We're just more familiar with 'concurrently' - and it works well.
preinstall: Need to build the children before we can 'npm install', since we're using them via 'file:' and they are Svelte-made.
(should maybe opt for a real dependency-oriented build system, instead)
